reviews.review_msg: The course is too painful. What cliff does is more or less what we call a destruction of humanity. I went to every single office hr to get help but he seems to see no improvement of you. It is a course to help you improve your writing skills, but Cliff used it to destroy your self-esteem on writing academic papers. Thank you for your help btw!

Keir was a very good prof. One of the best Ive had at SFU. Hes charismatic, approachable and lenient on deadlines if you ask. Hes very syntax heavy so if its not your strong suit youll have to really study. Overall, a good professor and a nice guy to say the least.

You will get 50% to 60% in grade for all the assignment that she grades. So annoying and terrible. I will defiantly avoid her no matter she as TA or instructor in future. In Ling282 Lucas marks much more better than she does.
Great Proffesor! She is very nice and willing to help, and believes a lot in particiaption and getting homework done in class, which was actually great.

Heather is amazing! Super nice, chill, and passionate about linguistics especially language revitalization. Her lectures are high quality but also content-heavy. As for the course itself, LING282W is a writing-heavy course, you will be doing writing *every week* and get marks docked for analysis, clarity, coherence, presentation, etc. It's hard.
